snippet: A panel in North Carolina has recommended closing three academic centers, including a poverty center and one dedicated to social change, sparking outrage among liberals.
abstract: Advisory panel at the University of North Carolina's Board of Governors recommends closing three academic centers, including a poverty center and one dedicated to social change; liberal groups accuse state's conservative majority of using changes to target ideological opponents.
